item.title: Hugging Face makes it easier for devs to run AI models on third-party clouds
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
AI dev platform Hugging Face has partnered with third-party cloud vendors including SambaNova to launch Inference Providers, a feature designed to make it easier for devs on Hugging Face to run AI models using the infrastructure of their choice. Hugging Face says partners including Fal, Replicate, Together AI, and the aforementioned SambaNova have worked with […]

item.title: Trump says Microsoft is in talks to acquire TikTok
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description:
President Donald Trump told reporters that Microsoft is in talks to acquire TikTok’s U.S. operations, Bloomberg reports. Although Trump didn’t elaborate, he stated that “there’s great interest in TikTok” and that there will be “a lot of people bidding on it.” Microsoft and Oracle were in the running to acquire the ByteDance-owned app back in […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: X announces a partnership with Visa to power X Money’s wallet
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
Elon Musk-owned social network X announced a partnership with Visa to handle person-to-person payments for its upcoming X Money product. The company will use Visa Direct, which is Visa’s solution for real-time money transfers, to load money into X Money’s wallet, connect to a debit card for paying other users, and transfer money back to […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: PowerSchool begins notifying students and teachers after massive data breach
item.dc:creator: Carly Page
item.description:
The edtech giant is notifying state attorneys general about the breach but won’t say how many individuals have been affected

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: OpenAI launches ChatGPT plan for U.S. government agencies
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
In a week dominated by headlines about China’s growing AI competitiveness, OpenAI has launched ChatGPT Gov. The new version of the AI-powered chatbot platform is designed to provide U.S. government agencies an additional way to access the tech. ChatGPT Gov includes many of the capabilities found in OpenAI’s corporate-focused tier, ChatGPT Enterprise. Using the platform, agencies […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Alice&Bob raises $104M, says quantum computers based on cat qubits will be ready by 2030
item.dc:creator: Ingrid Lunden
item.description:
Quantum computing remains something of a holy grail in the world of technology: it promises a huge leap in computing power, but only if someone can figure out how to square away the fault rates that prevent any scaling of the tech. Now, one of the more promising quantum startups in Europe is announcing a […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: ‘Blade’ writer David S. Goyer debuts his latest sci-fi franchise on Incention, a new platform built on Story blockchain
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description:
While the adoption of IP (intellectual property) blockchain and tokenization of assets is still in its early stages, more creatives in the entertainment industry are embracing what is called “tokenized storytelling.” This approach enables fans to participate in story development, contributing elements – such as characters and plot – that can be tokenized and owned […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Spotify says it paid $10 billion to music industry last year
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
Audio streaming company Spotify said Tuesday that it paid $10 billion to the music industry last year. The company added that it has given nearly $60 billion in industry payouts since its inception. This is another effort from Spotify to dispel reports that the company doesn’t reward artists properly for their work. The key point […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Lucid Gravity SUV owners will gain access to Tesla Superchargers on Jan 31
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description:
Owners of the electric Lucid Gravity SUV will gain access to Tesla’s Supercharging network starting January 31.  The Gravity is Lucid’s second vehicle model in its lineup after its flagship Air sedan series, and the first to be built with charge ports compatible with Tesla’s NACS (North American Charging Standard) charge plugs. Lucid Air owners will […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: ENGlobal says hackers accessed ‘sensitive personal’ data during cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Carly Page
item.description:
The engineering and automation contractor for the U.S. government said the hackers encrypted some of the company's files.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Atomicwork gets backing from Khosla for its AI alternative to old-school IT software like ServiceNow
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description:
Atomicwork has raised $25 million in a Series A round co-led by Khosla Ventures and Z47 to expand its AI agentic platform for enterprises.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Helion raises $425M to help build a fusion reactor for Microsoft
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description:
Helion's unorthodox approach to fusion power and relative secrecy has earned it plenty of fans — and critics. But don’t count its investors among the naysayers.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Microsoft tests ‘scareware blocker’ for Edge that uses computer vision to detect scams
item.dc:creator: Paul Sawers
item.description:
Microsoft is rolling out a new tool dubbed “scareware blocker,” which uses machine learning and computer vision to identify a very pervasive type of online scam. “Scareware” has blighted the web almost since its inception, often in the form of fake antivirus software that claims to have detected a non-existent threat on a user’s machine. […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Zepto shifts HQ to India as local listings gain appeal
item.dc:creator: Manish Singh
item.description:
Quick-commerce startup Zepto has moved its domicile to India from Singapore, joining a growing number of Indian startups that have moved their headquarters home ahead of an IPO in the country. The transition marks the fastest shift of registered headquarters to India by a startup in the country, according to Zepto’s chief financial officer Ramesh […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: TravelPerk raises $200M as valuation nearly doubles to $2.7B
item.dc:creator: Paul Sawers
item.description:
Barcelona-based business travel management platform TravelPerk has raised $200 million at a hefty $2.7 billion valuation — almost double the $1.4 billion valuation at its previous fundraise last year. Alongside the raise, TravelPerk also announced it has acquired Swiss startup Yokoy to bring native expenses management into the fray. With the travel and tourism industry […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Google Maps will soon rename Gulf of Mexico to ‘Gulf of America’
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
Google will rename the Gulf of Mexico and Alaska’s Denali mountain in Google Maps once a federal mapping database reflects changes ordered by the Trump Administration, the company announced Monday. Google is complying with an executive order issued last week by President Donald Trump that changed the names of several American landmarks. The executive order […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Reid Hoffman’s Manas AI raises $24.6M, a fraction of other AI drug discovery startups
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description:
LinkedIn founder Reid Hoffman and Siddhartha Mukherjee, cancer researcher and author of the book “The Emperor of All Maladies,” have co-founded an AI-powered drug discovery startup, Manas AI. The company, which will initially focus on breast cancer, prostate cancer, and lymphoma, has raised $24.6 million in seed funding from Hoffman, General Catalyst, and Greylock. Manas […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Former Intel CEO Pat Gelsinger is already using DeepSeek instead of OpenAI at his startup, Gloo
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description:
The tech industry's reaction to AI model DeepSeek R1 has been wild. Pat Gelsinger, for instance, is elated and thinks it will make AI better for everyone.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: SonicWall says hackers are exploiting a new zero-day bug to breach customer networks
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description:
SonicWall said the bug is "confirmed as being actively exploited in the wild" by malicious hackers.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Quartz has been quietly publishing AI-generated news articles
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description:
Quartz, the international business news outlet, has been quietly aggregating reporting from other outlets, including TechCrunch, in order to publish AI-generated articles under the byline “Quartz Intelligence Newsroom.”   Quartz started publishing simple AI-generated earnings reports months ago, but beginning last week, the outlet moved on to short articles. One of the 18 AI-generated articles published […]
